page.title: 18FARMING
page.content:
The area around Winter Hill is used mainly for the{farming}of sheep and beef cattle.Farmers have drained some of the land and developed it as {grassland.}Not many farm buildings are now occupied by farmers. They are being sold off by the Water Authority, often to people from the towns.A number of ruined farm buildings are still to be found,particularly in the valley of the River Yarrow.
Ward's Cote Farm,to the north of Belmont,consists of 86 acres.It has Derbyshire{sheep,}Angus and Hereford cattle and some chickens.The sheep are sheared each year and the wool goes to Bradford.The farm's machinery includes a hay making machine,tractors,manure spreader and a harrow.Some fields are used only for grazing whilst others provide a hay crop as well as grazing.
